generif.text: functions as lateral signal transmitter

Antiproliferative proteins of the BTG/Tob family are degraded by the ubiquitin-proteasome system.  the C-terminal regions are necessary and sufficient to control the stabilities of BTG1, BTG2, Tob, and Tob2 proteins.
identified as a MAPK substrate
Decreased expression or phosphorylation status of tob protein is associated with lung cancer
N-terminal region of TOB is a functional nuclear export signal.
Tob is involved in the translational suppression of IL-2 mRNA in anergic T cells through its interaction with iPABP.
Tob1 is a novel target for degradation by the SCF-Skp2 ubiquitin ligase in a cell line.
Reverse-transcription polymerase chain reaction confirmed increased expression of GADD45A, BTG2, PDE4B, and CEBPD and downregulation of TOB1 in skeletal muscle intradialysis.
Subtractive hybridization identified Twisted gastrulation (Tsg) as one of the genes suppressed by Tob.
Data show that TOB enhances mRNA deadenylation in vivo, and that interaction with PABPC1 is necessary for TOB's deadenylation-enhancing effect.
antiproliferative region of human Tob (residues 1-138) and intact hCaf1 were co-expressed in Escherichia coli, purified and successfully cocrystallized
Tob associates with the CCR4-NOT complex.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
positive correlation of TOB1 phosphorylation status with proliferation marker Ki67 suggests that elevated TOB1 phosphorylation might abrogate the antiproliferative effect of TOB1 in breast cancer
Down-regulation of TOB is associated with breast cancer tumorigenesis.
Tob interactions with Caf1 and a C-terminal domain of PABPC1
Together, these results indicate that Tob mediates the recruitment of Caf1 to the target of CPEB3 and elicits deadenylation and decay of the mRNA.
Silencing of HIC1 and TOB1 expression is a common occurrence in gastric cancer and may contribute to the development and progression of the disease.
Longer survival was associated with hypomethylation at specific CpG sites (e.g. GREB1, TGIF and TOB1) and hypermethylation in other genes (e.g. TMCO5, PTPRN and GUCY2C).

TOB1 overexpression not only increased the expression of the phosphatase and tensin homolog (PTEN), an important tumor suppressor, but also regulated the downstream effectors in the PI3K/PTEN signaling pathway, including Akt, ERK1/2, etc.
The antiproliferative and the mRNA deadenylation/decay-promoting effects of TOB1 and TOB2 proteins are linked.
study demonstrates that the overexpression of Tob1 inhibits gastric cancer progression by activating Smad4- and inhibiting betacatenin-mediated signaling pathways
Cdc7 phosphorylates and interacts with Tob to inhibit the Cul4-DDB1(Cdt2)-dependent Tob degradation.
Tob is a key factor in the regulation of c-myc gene expression, which is essential for cell growth.
TOB1 modulates the radiosensitivity of lung cancer cells via the MAPK/ERK signaling pathway.
TOB1 demonstrated a radioprotective function in the immortalized normal human bronchial epithelial cell line.
miR-25 promotes GC progression by directly downregulating TOB1 expression, and may be a noninvasive biomarker for the prognosis of GC patients.
arsenite-induced oxidative stress inhibits deadenylation of mRNA primarily through downregulation of Tob and Pan3, both of which mediate the recruitment of deadenylases to mRNA
Reduced TOB1 expression in gastric adenocarcinoma is associated with the extent of differentiation and the TNM stage of gastric cancer.
A novel role for TOB1 in mediating survival of estrogen-independent breast cancers.

The dual-luciferase reporter assay also confirmed that miR-25 harbored the A allele which caused an incapacitation of binding at the TOB1. In conclusion, rs41274221 in miR-25 was a subgroup which may protect the patients from further growth and metastasis of gastric cancer and might serve as a novel biomarker for the disease
MiR-590 targets Tob1 that is significantly decreased in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Our findings provide important insights into a previously unrecognized oncogenic role of Tob1 in colon cancer and suggest that Tob1 is an adverse prognostic factor and therapeutic target for colon cancer.

TOB1 was found to be directly targeted by miR-371a-3p, in which TOB1 was down-regulated by miR-371a-3p in gastric cancer (GC). Most importantly, results showed that TOB1 plays a tumor-suppressive role in GC cells, and it is required for the miR-371a-3p's oncogenic activities in GC cells.

The downregulation of DAL-1 and TOB1 expression is associated with shorter survival of gastric cancer patients and may be considered potential novel markers for predicting the outcomes of patients with gastric cancer
TOB1 suppresses proliferation in K-Ras wild-type pancreatic cancer.
LncRNA WEE2-AS1 promotes proliferation and inhibits apoptosis in triple negative breast cancer cells via regulating miR-32-5p/TOB1 axis.
Identification of miR253p as a tumor biomarker: Regulation of cellular functions via TOB1 in breast cancer.
Involvement of TOB1 on autophagy in gastric cancer AGS cells via decreasing the activation of AKT/mTOR signaling pathway.
Methylation Mediated Downregulation of TOB1-AS1 and TOB1 Correlates with Malignant Progression and Poor Prognosis of Esophageal Squamous Cell Carcinoma.
TOB1 modulates neutrophil phenotypes to influence gastric cancer progression and immunotherapy efficacy.

name: transducer of ERBB2, 1

wikipathways.name: Bone morphogenic protein (BMP) signaling and regulation

summary: This gene encodes a member of the transducer of erbB-2 /B-cell translocation gene protein family. Members of this family are anti-proliferative factors that have the potential to regulate cell growth. The encoded protein may function as a tumor suppressor. Alternate splicing results in multiple transcript variants. [provided by RefSeq, Aug 2011].
